   related to C. diff and acute renal failure.
   .

   multiple recent hospitalizations and her multiple comorbidities, she is

   .

   Pt more responsive to family than physicians and thus it is difficult
   to access her mental status.  Monitor today.  If worsens would consider
   LP but afebrile now and no meningeal signs.
   .
   5. Acute Renal Failure
   Patient is in renal failure with creatinine elevated to 2.2 from 1.1 on
   admission and is down to 2 today. Etiology is unclear but is concerning
   for ATN in the setting of hypotension given marked elevation in
   creatinine over 24 hours and given BUN/Creatinine ratio of [**10-7**]:1.

   additional history to suggest post-renal obstruction.
   - check urine lytes

   .
   6. H/o Breast Cancer: Did not get arimidex given pt now on vent and not
   taking POs
   7. Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus  Patient has a history of T2DM and was only
   on insulin sliding scale.
   - continue humalog sliding scale, consider insulin gtt if sugar is not
   well controlled

   Stable
   - continue PPI
   .

   Patient has a history of atrial fibrillation. She was recently
